pli-tv-bu-vb-sk54:2.1: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk54:5.1: 54. The training rule on licking the lips
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk54:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk54:6.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were eating licking their lips. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk54:7.2: “‘I will not eat licking my lips,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk54:8.1: One should not eat licking the lips.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk54:8.2: If a monk out of disrespect eats licking his lips, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk54:9.2: if it is unintentional; if he is not mindful; if he does not know; if he is sick; if there are dangers; if he is insane;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk54:9.3: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk54:10.1: The fourth training rule is finished.
